notes: Reproduced on macOS arm64: DrawVertices with vertex colors produces a solid black triangle instead of a colored gradient. The default SKPaint color is black (#ff000000), and in SkiaSharp 3.x the paint color appears to be modulated with vertex colors, resulting in all-black output. In v2.88.9, vertex colors display correctly as a gradient. Bug persists on latest release (3.119.2) and on main branch source.

versionResults.notes: Vertex colors display correctly as a gradient triangle with Red, Green, Blue vertices.
Triangle is solid black — all sampled pixels are #ff000000. Reporter's version.
Still black on latest stable release.
Test DrawVerticesWithColorsProducesColoredTriangle fails — center pixel is #ff000000. Bug persists on main.

errorMessages.primaryError: DrawVertices renders solid black triangle instead of colored gradient — all pixel samples return #ff000000 when vertex colors (Red, Green, Blue) should produce interpolated color values

triageCorrections.corrected: Bug also reproduces on macOS arm64 — this is a cross-platform rendering regression, not Windows-specific
